Articles.Content: I have tried twice to report posts (not because of any rule violation, once to suggest that the word a.nalysis be added to the profanity exceptions and once to inform a mod they had posted a typo in a version number) but both times the browser just sat there waiting for the response from the server. Is it broken in some way or has it been disabled deliberately (in a way that makes it look broken) or is this a consequence of high load on the server?

It gets through, but without confirmation. Gimme five to find the source.

EDIT: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/708-Forum-Reports-and-You-A-Lesson-in-Patience

Edited July 19, 2014 by KvickFlygarn87

KvickFlygarn87 has it. The window seems to hang, eventually returning to the thread you were viewing (though sometimes it 502s). The report actually goes through fairly quickly, long before the page reload or eventual error.
Both those reports went through and we saw them, don't worry. There's a bit of a weird bug in vBulletin that sometimes makes the page hang and doesn't give the confirmation, but the report is sent.
